Description: Shoulder fragment of North Ionian black-figure pottery oinochoe; interior reserved; exterior, cream slip: tongue frieze at shoulder between lines; in shoulder frieze, part of a roughly drawn sphinx to right, facing a swan Only head preserved); filling ornaments: rosettes and swastikas with dots; added red on hair, alternate feathers of the wing of the sphinx, wing outline and every fourth tongue; incision used for details of sphinx and of swan and for part of sphinx's outline. Plastic ridge at shoulder-neck transition. Drill hole in broken edge from sampling for analysis.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 32)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.626)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.13)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
